[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 81]
Reasoning: I'm in a PLANET_PACK game step, meaning I need to select a planet card from the booster pack to level up a hand type.

Let me look at my options:
1. Pluto - Level up High Card (+1 Mult and +10 chips)
2. Earth - Level up Full House (+2 Mult and +25 chips)
3. Mars - Level up Four of a Kind (+3 Mult and +30 chips)

Context:
- I'm heading into the Boss Blind which requires playing only ONE hand type
- My most-played and highest-level hand is Two Pair (Level 4, 80 chips, 5 mult, played 10 times)
- I need 10,000 chips for the Boss Blind

Unfortunately, none of these planet cards level up Two Pair directly! This is disappointing.

Let me think about which of these options could be most useful:

1. High Card - Level 1 currently (5 chips, 1 mult). Would become 15 chips, 2 mult. This is my backup if I can't make any other hand.

2. Full House - Level 1 currently (40 chips, 4 mult). Would become 65 chips, 6 mult. A full house is harder to make than two pair, but it contains a two pair (three of a kind + pair = full house which contains two pair).

3. Four of a Kind - Level 1 currently (60 chips, 7 mult). Would become 90 chips, 10 mult. This is even harder to make than full house.

Wait, let me reconsider the boss constraint. It says "Play only 1 hand type this round". This means I need to commit to playing the SAME hand type for every hand I play during the boss round. I can't mix and match.

Given that:
- Two Pair is my strongest and most reliable hand
- I don't have a planet for Two Pair available


- I need to pick one hand type to play repeatedly during the boss round

The real question is whether any of these alternatives could work as a substitute strategy. Full House is interesting because it technically contains two pair within its structure, though I'm not certain if that satisfies the boss requirement. High Card is always available but weak. Four of a Kind would be difficult to assemble consistently. I should think about whether I can even reliably construct Four of a Kind or Full House with my current deck composition.

Looking at what I have left - 40 cards with most ranks appearing 3-5 times, except 3s with only 1 copy and 9s with 2 - Four of a Kind seems unreliable since I'd need four identical cards. Full House is more feasible since I need three of one rank and two of another. But this raises a bigger problem: none of these planets actually improve my Two Pair strategy, which has been working well throughout the game. Since I must choose something from this pack, I need to evaluate which option is least detrimental to my overall approach. So if I commit to Two Pair, that's the only hand type I can play throughout the entire round. Given that Two Pair is already Level 4 and performing well, I should stick with it rather than chase a different hand type. Earth (Full House) still seems like the strongest pick among the available planets—it offers meaningful stat increases and provides a fallback option if my primary strategy falters. I'll go with Earth.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

The plan was to buy Even Steven to give me flexibility in playing either even or odd-focused Two Pairs depending on what I draw. I now have 4 joker slots filled (out of 5 max), and $14 in cash.

Should I buy Even Steven for $4?

**With Even Steven (playing 4 even cards in Two Pair):**

- Card values: ~20 chips (4 even cards)

**Without Even Steven (playing 4 odd cards in Two Pair):**

, bringing total chips to ~328
- Base mult: 5
- Swashbuckler: +8 mult = 13 mult
- If 2 Hearts: 13 × 1.5 × 1.5 = 29.25 mult
- Final score: ~328 × 29.25 = ~9,594 chips

The even Steven route clears the 10,000 threshold comfortably at ~13,311, whereas the odd path falls short at ~9,594. Even Steven seems like the safer choice. I've got $14 available and Even Steven costs $4, leaving $10 to work with. I should think about what else I could purchase with the remaining budget.

Rerolling for $5 might reveal better options, but I'm facing the Boss Blind soon and need reliability over exploration. Seed Money would boost my interest cap from $5 to $10 for long-term economy, but that's less critical right now than securing this round. Even Steven at $4 is the pragmatic play. Adding cards via Standard Pack would dilute my deck further since I'm already at 52 cards, so that's not worth it either.

Madness is clearly a trap with its X0.5 multiplier and joker destruction. Even Steven gives me the flexibility and scoring boost I need to consistently break past 10,000 points.
